title: Create and execute a dividend
body: To calculate dividends and create dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios, follow the steps:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Open the Dividends view.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Click Add dividend in the top-right corner of the view and fill in the fields:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Fund

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The fund that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Share class

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The share class that pays the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Declaration date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The date when the dividend payment is announced.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Ex-date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend ex-date. The dividend is calculated based on the number of share class units in the shareholder's portfolio on the morning of the ex-date (the position after the previous day's transactions). This date will become the transaction date of the created dividend transaction. When you calculate NAV on the ex-date, the dividend isn't anymore included in NAV.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Payment date

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The payment date of the dividend, when the dividend is actually paid to the shareholder. Payment date becomes the settlement date of the created dividend transaction.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Dividend per unit

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: The dividend to pay per share class unit.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Transaction type to use for the dividend transactions. By default, FA Fund Management uses the Fund dividend (FMDIV) transaction type.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Memo note for the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: If the dividend execution date is today, proceed to executing the dividend by clicking Save and execute.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Alternatively, save the dividend and execute it later (click Execute in the Dividends view).

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Check the tax rates and FX rate in the Dividend view that opens. Click Execute to generate dividend transactions. The dividend status changes to "Executing", and then to "Executed" in the Dividends view. You can view the dividend transactions by double-clicking the dividend.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: As a result, FA Fund management does the following:

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates dividend transactions in the shareholder portfolios.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: Creates a cashout transaction (FMDWD type) to take out the dividend amount from the fund portfolio. Next time you calculate NAV, the total dividend amount is excluded from the calculation.

title: Create and execute a dividend
body: You can ensure that all shareholders received dividends by clicking Reconcile in the Dividends view. The system shows a confirmation message that reads "Dividend transactions are created for all shareholders".

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can edit an unexecuted dividend by doing the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: For the dividend you want to modify, click the icon and select Edit.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Make your changes in the side pane that opens.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If you want to proceed to executing the dividend, click Save and execute and fill in the tax rates and FX rate. If you want to execute the dividend later, click Save.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: You can cancel dividend transactions for executed dividends, for example, if you notice that some tax rates are incorrect or if the error is due to incorrect positions in shareholder portfolios. To cancel dividend transactions, do the following:

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Double-click an executed dividend in the table.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Select the dividend transactions to delete and click the  icon.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: If needed, make corrections in the shareholders' portfolios.

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Click Reconcile next to the dividend in the Dividends view and confirm that you want to execute missing transactions (Execute).

title: Edit dividends or dividend transactions
body: Enter the correct dividend parameters (you can only correct tax or exchange rates that are not used in any transactions) and click Execute.

title: Dividend transaction properties

title: Receive fund orders

title: View order details
body: To view details for a fund order, click on a row in the list. In the side pane that opens, you can see the following information:

title: View order details
body: Fund order details: Shows the same information as the fund order list columns and the fund order execution method and reference.

title: View order details
body: Documents: Shows documents uploaded for the order, the tags applied to them, and the date and time they were last modified. You can download the documents to your computer.

title: Order information
body: Account

title: Order information
body: The fund or share account to record deposits and withdrawals. The default account used in trade orders is specified in the fund and share class settings

body: The trade amount from the client's perspective. The amount on each row is summed up into a total amount shown in the last row.

title: Order information

title: Order information
body: Description on statement

title: Order information

title: Set up a management fee
body: Example: The yearly management fee is 0,1%. The fund's previous NAV is 365 000 EUR. The used day count convention is "ACT/ACT ISDA" and the selected holiday calendar is "Saturday/Sunday weekends". The calculated fee is 365 000 EUR * 0,1% / 365 days * 1 day = 1 EUR. If we change the holiday calendar to "No holidays/weekends", the fee is calculated for all three days and amounts to 3 EUR.

title: Set up a management fee

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: The next step is to include the fee in your fund's fee structure. You can apply the management fee on the fund or on the share class level. Fund-level fees are applied to all share classes. They are calculated first, in the order you place them in the fund settings, followed by the share class fees.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: To define the fee parameters:

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: In the fund settings:

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Set the fee capitalization account for the fund in the Basic info tab. Enable Set as fee capitalization account for the cash account you want to use for fee capitalization. You can only set one account for fee capitalization per fund. If you do not set a fee capitalization account, the system uses the account you marked as the default account in the Basic info tab.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: (Optional) If you want to use a separate schedule for calculating fees ( see Ongoing fees for details), set it up in the Schedules tab.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Define the fee crystallization schedule in the Schedules tab. For details about schedule settings, see Create a fund.

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: Add the management fee on the fund or share class level. Open the Fee structure tab in the fund or share class settings, add the fee formula, percentage and other parameters (for details about fee parameters, see Create a fund and Add share classes).

title: Add the fee to the fee structure
body: When the fee calculation and capitalization has been set up in FA Fund Management, accrued fee transactions are created every time you calculate NAV. When it is time for capitalization, go to FA Back and create transactions to withdraw the fees from the fund cash account and deposit them to the fund fee account. Follow the instructions in Handle accrued fees and capitalization in FA User guide.

title: Set up a performance fee
body: A performance fee is calculated based on the fund return. For each day in the calculation period, the NAV increase is compared to a threshold (benchmark, hurdle rate, or index), and the difference is multiplied by the fee percentage. The daily fees are summed to get the total amount.

You can only set one account for fee capitalization per fund. If you do not set a fee capitalization account, the system uses the account you marked as the default account in the Basic info tab.

title: Define the fee parameters
body: You can track the accrued fee in the NAV overview. When it is time for crystallization, go to FA Back and create transactions to withdraw the fees from the fund cash account and deposit them to the fund fee account. Follow the instructions in Handle accrued fees and capitalization in FA User guide.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: Performance fee with equalization ensures that every shareholder pays the same percentage of performance fee no matter when they subscribed to the fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For the fee equalization, the fund subscriptions are executed with NAV excluding the performance fee. To equalize the performance fee in the future, FA Fund Management creates compensation trade orders for buying or selling fund units. The trade order type depends on the current share class NAV (without performance fee) compared to the high-water mark (HWM) - the highest NAV value in the share class:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is smaller than HWM, a trade order with Equalization debit (EQDE) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: If NAV (without performance fee) is greater than HWM, a trade order with Equalization credit (EQCR) transaction type is created.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The trade amount is calculated as subscription amount * performance fee per unit.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: On the crystallization date, when you accept NAV:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: HWM is updated to the NAV value if the current NAV is higher than HWM.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: The compensation trade orders are executed.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: To set up the performance fee with equalization, you need to specify the schedule for the fund and enter the fee details on the share class level:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the fund settings:

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the fund settings, Schedules tab, set the fee crystallization schedule. For a newly created fund, the first fee date in the schedule must be the same as the fund inception date you entered in the Basic info tab. If you transfer an existing fund into FA Fund management app, make sure that the first fee date is the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the Fee structure tab, select Calculate performance equalization fee with contingent redemption method. The "Performance fee with crystallization" formula is used to equalize the performance fee on the crystallization date.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Create a fund.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: In the share class settings, specify the fee properties in the Fee structure tab, Performance fee equalization section.

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: For details and field descriptions, see Add share classes).

title: Set up performance fee equalization
body: FA Fund management app accrues the performance fee every time you calculate and accept NAV. On the crystallization date, when you calculate and accept NAV, FA Fund management calculates performance fee and creates compensation trade orders. You can view the fee amount in the NAV window.

title: NAV report
body: FA Fund management app can generate reports that summarize the NAV calculation information as a PDF or XLSX file. To learn more about NAV report content, see NAV report (PDF) and NAV report (XLSX).

title: Download NAV report
body: The system generates NAV reports when you accept NAV in the FA Fund Management app. To download the NAV report in FA Fund Management, do the following:

title: Download NAV report
body: In the NAV status view, double-click the fund to open the NAV overview.

title: Download NAV report
body: In the top right corner of the NAV overview, click the icon to download the report as a PDF or the icon to download the report as an XLSX file.

title: Download NAV report
body: To download NAV reports in FA Back, open the Portfolio window for a fund and go to the Documents tab.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: You can set up the FA Fund Management app to automatically send out NAV reports via email, for example, every day at a certain time. You need to first enable the sending of reports in FA Fund Management and then set up the sending schedule in FA Back. To do this, take the following steps:

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: In the NAV status view, click on the fund and then click on the icon to open the fund settings.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Open the NAV reporting tab.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Tick the checkbox for Send report via email and enter the email address of the recipient. You can choose to receive the reports as PDF or XLSX files or both.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Schedule the report sending in FA Back. We recommend that your administrator schedules the "Send documents via email" process (for instructions, see Scheduling settings in FA Admin guide).

title: NAV report (PDF)
body: The NAV report consists of NAV calculation details shown in the different tabs of the NAV overview. To generate the NAV report as a PDF, click the icon in the top right of the view.

title: Summary of calculated NAV
body: The Summary of calculated NAV section of the report shows a summary of the current NAV calculation. For field descriptions, see NAV summary.

title: Details of calculated NAV
body: The Details of calculated NAV section of the report shows details for each NAV calculation item: the market value of investments, accrued interest, account balances, receivables, liabilities, and fees. For field descriptions, see NAV summary.

title: Summary of share class NAVs
body: The Summary of share class NAVs section of the report shows a summary of share class NAVs and then detailed information per share class. For field descriptions, see Share classes tab.

title: Portfolio
body: The Portfolio section of the report shows portfolio position information. For field descriptions, see View the fund portfolio.

title: Warnings
body: The Warnings section of the report shows four types of warnings that can be generated by a NAV calculation: NAV warnings, share class warnings, portfolio warnings, and limit warnings. For more details on each warning type, see View warnings.

title: Limits
body: The Limits section of the report shows a post-trade limits analysis generated when you calculate NAV. To have the system generate the analysis in the NAV report, you need to set up limits for your fund in FA Back (see Limit analysis and Set up investment limits for mutual fund portfolios in FA User guide). For field descriptions of the limit analysis, see Generate limit report in FA User guide.

title: NAV report (XLSX)
body: The NAV report consists of NAV calculation details shown in the different tabs of the NAV overview. To generate the NAV report as an XLSX file, click the  icon in the top right of the view.

title: Preview summary
body: The Preview summary section of the report shows the summary of the current NAV calculation. For field descriptions, see NAV summary.

title: Share classes
body: The Share classes section of the report shows NAV calculation by share class. For field descriptions, see Share classes tab.

title: Share classes
body: Additionally, the XLSX report shows Previous NAV (pf) which is the previous NAV in the portfolio currency, and Previous NAV (sec) which is the previous NAV in the share class currency.

title: Portfolio
body: The Portfolio section of the report shows portfolio position information. For field descriptions, see View the fund portfolio.

title: Warnings
body: The Warnings section of the report shows four types of warnings that can be generated by a NAV calculation: NAV warnings, share class warnings, portfolio warnings, and limit warnings. For more details on each warning type, see View warnings.

title: Limits
body: The Limits section of the report shows a post-trade limits analysis generated when you calculate NAV. To have the system generate the analysis in the NAV report, you need to set up limits for your fund in FA Back (see Limit analysis  and Set up investment limits for mutual fund portfoliosin FA User guide). For field descriptions of the limit analysis, see Generate limit report in FA User guide.

title: View warnings
body: When you calculate NAV, FA Fund Management checks the underlying data and shows you warnings if there is anything to double-check. To view the warnings, double-click the fund in the NAV overview and open the Warnings tab.

title: NAV warnings
body: NAV warnings mean that there is something wrong with the fund or NAV calculation settings, and NAV calculation failed. Possible reasons include:

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account.

title: NAV warnings
body: Missing accrued fee account balance (normal when there are no earlier fees of the type).

title: NAV warnings
body: Cost formula is invalid and doesn't return any transactions.

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Share class and portfolio warnings are based on the decision table rules that check share classes and portfolios. The decision table contains checks listed below, most of which you can adjust (see Add warnings for NAV calculation in FA Admin guide).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Adjustable warnings:

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Negative positions or cash account balance (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 5% for stocks (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Price has changed more than 1% for other securities and currencies (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: FX rate has changed more than 5% (portfolio). This check can be adjusted separately for securities and cash accounts.

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Market price older than calculation date (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Fund performance vs. benchmark differs by more than 1% (share class).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: Market price history missing (portfolio).

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: System warning (not adjustable):

title: Share class and portfolio warnings
body: The difference in the outstanding units in the current and previous NAV calculation does not match the number of units from the executed transactions (share class).

title: Limit warnings
body: Limit warnings mean that the fund portfolio positions are close to or outside the warning or breach thresholds set for the portfolio.

title: Limit warnings
body: Warning: portfolio values are beyond the warning threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: Breached: portfolio values are outside the breach threshold.

title: Limit warnings
body: To learn more about setting investment limits in FA Back, see UCITS limits.

title: Fund reporting data
body: FA Fund management provides you with fund performance-related data that you can use to produce fund factsheets and reports:

title: Fund reporting data
body: Portfolio content grouped by asset classes and types, showing the market value, share of total and share of parent.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Share class performance, showing TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, SRRI.

title: Fund reporting data
body: Fund performance, showing TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, turnover.

title: Fund reporting data
body: The data is generated regularly according to the schedule you set up for the fund. When the data is calculated, you can preview and accept it.

title: Fund reporting data
body: To create reports based on the generated data, you need to build a report template. To learn more, see the Reporting section in FA Developer guide.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter the view name. If you used the search fields at the top and want to save them, make sure the checkbox Save current search criteria is ticked.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: To generate fund reporting data:

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Set the schedule for calculation the reporting data. To do this, choose the fund in the NAV overview and click to open the Fund wizard. Go to the Fund reporting tab, enable fund reporting and define the schedule. For the field details, see Create a fund.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Calculate the reporting data (make sure your fund is in the "Pending" status). You can mass-calculate the data or start the calculations one by one from the side panel in the Fund analysis view.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: View and check the reporting data in the Analysis overview. After the calculation is completed, you can preview the data by clicking the fund in the list. For details about the figures, see Fund reporting data in the Reporting overview.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you notice a mistake in the underlying data that caused an incorrect calculation, make the necessary fixes. Click the fund in the list and then Recalculate.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: If you calculated the reporting data on the wrong date, for example, due to an incorrect schedule, you can delete the calculation data from the system. Double-click the fund in the list and click Delete.

title: Generate fund reporting data
body: Accept the calculation if the data is correct (click Accept).

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: You can track the reporting data calculation status in the Fund analysis view and see if you need to calculate the reporting data today.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Fund reporting can have the following statuses:

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No schedule

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: The calculation schedule is missing in the fund settings.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No action

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: No calculation or acceptance needs to be carried out today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Pending

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate the reporting data for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s reporting data.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Calculated

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was already calculated, and you can accept it.

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Accepted

title: Follow the fund reporting statuses
body: Reporting data was accepted today. The next calculation date is in the future.

title: Fund reporting data in the Reporting overview
body: Analysis overview shows the reporting data you calculated. The date in the top-right corner shows the latest calculation date. You can choose a previous date to view the history.

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs show fund portfolio analyzed as a whole and by share class. The indicators are:

title: KPI tabs
body: For the fund portfolio: TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, turnover.

title: KPI tabs
body: For the share classes: TWR, alpha, beta, tracking error, vol ann, information ratio, SRRI.

title: KPI tabs
body: To learn more about these indicators, see Analytics+ in FA Back reference.

title: Holdings tab
body: Holdings tab

title: Holdings tab
body: The Holdings tab shows the fund portfolio content, with market value and share of total specified for each position.

title: Allocation: Asset class tab
body: Allocation: Asset class tab

title: Allocation: Asset class tab
body: The Allocation: Asset class tab shows the fund portfolio analyzed by asset type and asset class for all allocation groups.

title: Performance tab
body: Performance tab

title: Performance tab
body: The Performance tab shows the fund portfolio performance since the fund inception as a graph.

title: Track changes and view history
body: FA Operations tracks the changes made by the users and stores the history of reconciliations and reconciliation items.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Audit logs show who and when made changes to a reconciliation or a reconciliation item. You can see the old and new value of the property that was changed.

title: Track changes and view history
body: Reconciliation history shows closed reconciliations and items.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a reconciliation, open the reconciliation in the Reconciliation overview or History view and click Audit log at the upper right.

title: Audit logs
body: To access audit logs for a specific reconciliation item, open it in the Reconciliation overview or History view and go to the Audit log section.

title: Reconciliation history
body: Reconciliation history

title: Reconciliation history
body: To access all reconciliations that have been uploaded in FA Operations and view the reconciliation items, open the History view.

title: View reconciliations
body: The Reconciliations tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliations in the system. You can:

title: View reconciliations
body: Download the reconciliations list in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View reconciliations
body: View reconciliation details and the list of reconciled items (click in the reconciliation row). To download the reconciliation report, then click Download report in the upper-right corner. If the reconciliation is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation.

title: View reconciliations
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: View all reconciliation items
body: The Reconciliation items tab of the History view shows the list of all reconciliation items that have been uploaded in the system. You can:

title: View all reconciliation items
body: Download the list of all items in the CSV or XLSX format (click Export).

title: View all reconciliation items
body: View the details and the audit log of each reconciliation item (click in the item row). To download the reconciliation report, click the PDF icon . If the item is open, you can make changes or rerun the reconciliation for it.

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view your customers, or all customers in the system, and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks: calls, emails, letters, meetings, or custom tasks that you define.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a summary of a customer's investments or see more details in FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Keep track of unsigned trade orders that the customer needs to accept.

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage tasks, documents, and notes related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view allows you to view customer information in a table. To open a specific customer's details, click  in the Actions column. To access a customer's investments or trade on their behalf, click  in the Actions column to open the FA Client Portal app.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Use the Customer groups dropdown to view different groups of customers. View customers you are linked to as a representative by selecting "My customers" (default selection), all customers in the system by selecting "All customers", or customers linked to a specific representative by selecting their name. You can also save your selection or set it as the default (see Adjust the view).

title: Viewing options
body: Export customers as a CSV or XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Viewing options
body: Convert all visible currency values to a specific currency by selecting it in the Currency dropdown.

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.

title: Adjust the view
body: Change the width by dragging the boundary.

title: Adjust the view
body: Sort by clicking the column name.

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust table row density ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Filter the table based on column content ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Search the table with the search fields at the top of the view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click and enter the view name. If you used the search fields at the top and want to save them, make sure the checkbox Save current search criteria is ticked.

title: Adjust the view
body: Click Save.

title: Adjust the view
body: The adjustments are saved as a view. You can now:

title: Adjust the view
body: Set a saved view as the default. To do this, click the Saved views field or , and then click the star icon next to the saved view.

title: Adjust the view
body: Open a saved view, work with it and make changes to it, and then use to restore the view to its previously saved settings.

title: Adjust the view
body: Clear the saved view and return to the initial system view (click in the Saved views field).

title: Adjust the view
body: Rename or delete saved views (click to open the saved views sidepane).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: You can see the following information as columns in the Customers view or fields in the Customer details:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Advisors

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's advisors (contacts with contact type 2 in FA Back). You can edit contact definitions under contact type 2 in FA Back (Preference → Contacts → Contact types).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Cash

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of cash in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Date of birth

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's date of birth.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in the FA Platform.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Identity format of the customer, for example passport. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Investments

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Amount of investments, excluding cash, in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Language of reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Order status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Trade order status. If the customer has unsigned trade orders, the column shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represented by

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons who represent the customer and the tags specified for them in the customer profile. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can add representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Represents

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Persons the customer represents and optional tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit representatives in FA Back (see Representatives in FA Back reference).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Status of the customer record in the system (active, passive, or closed). Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Total assets

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Combined amount of cash and investments in portfolios where the customer is the main contact. The value is shown in the portfolio currency.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor views
body: Level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Add notes and documents
body: The Notes and history section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, maintain notes about customer meetings, and view completed tasks related to the customer. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can also see it in FA Advisor.

title: Add notes and documents
body: To display notes in FA Advisor correctly, we recommend you use, for example, Google Chrome or Safari as your browser.

title: Manage notes
body: In the Notes and history section, the Notes tab allows you to add notes related to the customer or meetings with the customer and link them to specific dates. Notes are also shown in FA Back Contact window, Documents tab. If you delete a note in FA Back, it is also deleted from FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: You can create meeting notes from templates uploaded in FA Back (see Administering documents in FA Admin guide) or from a blank note the same way you can create general notes. To add a note, do the following:

title: Manage notes
body: Click Add note. To create a meeting note, select one of the meeting note templates or "Blank". To create a general note, select "Blank".

title: Manage notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note. If you created a blank note, select the note Category (meeting note or general note).

title: Manage notes
body: Enter the content in the text editor.

title: Manage notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage notes
body: To download notes as text files, select them in the list and click Download. You can also print or save a note as a PDF by opening it and clicking the icon.

title: Manage note tabs
body: You can add general information about the customer in the Customer info tab in the Notes and history section. If you have stored information in the customer's contact memo in FA Back (in the Contact window), you can view a tab called FA Back note. Note that you can only edit or delete the memo in FA Back. You can also add new tabs in the Notes and history section.

title: Manage note tabs
body: To add a new tab, do the following:

title: Manage note tabs
body: Click + Add tab and enter a name for it.

title: Manage note tabs
body: Add content in the text editor.

title: Manage note tabs
body: Click Save.

title: Store documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload and add the documents.

title: Store documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Portal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: The document is uploaded. To edit the category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal for an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Store documents
body: For each document, you can see the following information:

title: Store documents
body: Category

title: Store documents
body: Document category, for example, agreement or investment plan. Document categories are defined as tags under "Document type" in FA Back (Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Store documents
body: Document name

title: Store documents
body: The file name. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Store documents
body: Uploaded by

title: Store documents
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Store documents
body: Upload date

title: Store documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Store documents
body: Signing status

title: Store documents
body: Document signing status: canceled, done, error, expired, pending or waiting. These document signing statuses are included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise statuses are defined in FA Back in Preference → Tags → Document tags under "Document signing". Documents are sent for signing in FA Back (see Document signing in User guide).

title: Store documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: Store documents
body: Document availability to customer in FA Client Portal, indicated with a checkmark. You can make a document available when uploading by ticking the Show in FA Client Portal checkbox. In FA Back, documents that are available in FA Client Portal are assigned the tag "Online" (included in FA Standard Solution, otherwise the tag is defined in Preference → Tags → Document tags).

title: Manage tasks
body: Tasks allow you to plan and record your actions when communicating with a customer. You can schedule, for example, calls, emails, letters, and meetings and make notes related to them. You can create other task types in the FA Developer app (see Add a task type to FA Advisor in FA Developer guide). When a task is done, you can mark it as completed. The following sections describe how you can add tasks, search for tasks, and mark tasks as completed.

title: Add a task
body: You can add a new task related to a customer by doing the following:

title: Add a task
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, click Add task and select the task type (for example, call, email or letter, or meeting). Alternatively, you can click Add task in the Tasks view.

title: Add a task
body: Select the Assignee who should complete the task and define the Due date (for details, see Task information). You can also mark the task as completed.

title: Add a task
body: Click Save.

title: Work on tasks
body: When working with a customer, you can see open tasks related to them by going to the Customer details and viewing the Open tasks section. To view and manage all tasks assigned to you or any other user, go to the Tasks view. The Tasks view allows you to do the following:

title: Work on tasks
body: Search for tasks based on assignee, task type, and task status.

title: Work on tasks
body: View only tasks assigned to you by selecting "Assigned to me" in the Assignee filter.

title: Work on tasks
body: Open the task details by clicking the icon in the Actions column. You can:

title: Work on tasks
body: View the contact information of the customer or access their profile by clicking Open customer details.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task assignee by selecting a different user in the Assignee field.

title: Work on tasks
body: Change the task status by editing the Due date (future due date gives the task "Open" status, while past due date gives the task "Overdue" status).

title: Work on tasks
body: Mark the task as complete.

title: Task information
body: The following information is available for tasks:

title: Task information
body: Assignee

title: Task information
body: The user the task is assigned to. You can assign the task to yourself or another user by selecting them in the dropdown.

title: Task information
body: Customer

title: Task information
body: The name of the customer.

title: Task information
body: Creator

title: Task information
body: The user who created the task.

title: Task information
body: Due date

title: Task information
body: The date by which the task needs to be completed.

title: Task information
body: Note

title: Task information
body: Notes about the task.

title: Task information
body: Status

title: Task information
body: Task status ("Open", "Overdue", or "Completed"). The "Overdue" status is applied to tasks with a due date in the past. The "Completed" status is applied to tasks marked as complete.

title: Task information
body: Task type

title: Task information
body: Type of action. Standard task types are call, email or letter, and meeting.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: After finishing a task, you can mark it as completed by doing the following:

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click the icon in the Actions column of a task to open the side pane.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Tick the checkbox Mark task as completed.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: Click Save.

title: Mark a task as complete
body: The task status changes to "Completed". You can view completed tasks for a customer in the Customer details view, Notes and history section.

title: Manage customer's investments
body: You can view a summary of customer investments in FA Advisor. You can also create trade orders on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. Trade orders are sent for execution after the customer signs them.

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details, you can view a summary of a customer's investments in the Investments section. You can view the investment summary for the customer's active portfolios in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: As a table by clicking . The table shows the portfolio name, ID, currency, and in the portfolio currency the value (existing holdings and executed amount) of securities, cash accounts, and market value. The portfolios are in alphabetical order by default, but you can sort the columns in ascending or descending order.

title: View customer's investments
body: As a pie chart by clicking , but only if the customer's portfolios are all in the same currency. The pie chart shows the name, ID, and total value of active portfolios. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are grouped together. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios in the same currency, the pie chart displays 9 portfolios and the remaining portfolios are grouped together.

title: View customer's investments
body: You can also access the customer's investments via FA Client Portal in the following ways:

title: View customer's investments
body: In the Customer details view, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right.

title: View customer's investments
body: Open the Customers view and click the icon in the Actions column.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can buy, sell, or switch securities and make deposits and withdrawals on behalf of the customer via FA Client Portal. When making trade orders on behalf of the customer, you can also send them to be signed by the customer before execution. Make sure you have access to trading on behalf of customers and that sending documents for signing is enabled.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can only trade via FA Client Portal with portfolios in the group "ADV_TRADING" and securities in groups that start with "ADV_.". The groups are assigned in FA Back (see Security groups and Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of a customer, do the following:

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: In the Customers view, click the icon in the Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details. The customer's FA Client Portal opens.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure you have the rights to trade by checking the banner at the top of the view. Allowed actions are written in green with a check mark next to them.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make the trade order, deposit, or withdrawal. For information on how to make trade orders, deposits, and withdrawals, see FA Client Portal documentation.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: The trade order you created is tagged with "Advisor" in FA Back and has the pending signing status until the customer signs it. The customer's Status column in the Customers view now shows "Unsigned trade orders". The system sends the trade order to the customer for signing.

title: Cancel a trade order
body: You can cancel trade orders in the customer's FA Client Portal app. For details on how to cancel trade orders, see Orders view in FA Client Portal.

title: Track pending trade orders
body: If a customer has pending trade orders, you can keep track of them in several places:

title: Track pending trade orders
body: In the Customers view, the Status column shows if the customer has pending trade orders.

title: Track pending trade orders
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, you can see a list of pending trade orders in the Customer tab. Pending orders are listed as trade order signing tasks with a due date. You can also download the trade order report to your computer by clicking the icon in the Actions column.

title: Enable features for FA Client Portal users
body: You can enable or restrict various features for the user in FA Client Portal. The following sections explain the process of enabling and restricting features for users in FA Client Portal.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: You can hide subportfolios from the user in FA Client Portal. Hidden subportfolios are removed from the portfolio selector, but all figures are still aggregated into the parent portfolio. For more information on portfolio summaries in FA Client Portal, see Overview.

title: Hide subportfolios
body: To hide subportfolios from the Client Portal, assign the "Client Portal: Hide sub portfolio" tag to the subportfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Make documents available
body: You can provide access to the uploaded documents or documents available on the Internet by linking them:

title: Make documents available
body: To make documents available in FA Client Portal, upload them in FA Back and save them with the "Online" tag. To make documents related to specific securities available to the FA Client Portal user, upload them in the Security window, Documents tab, and add the "Online" tag to them. The documents are then listed below the prospectus and KID in FA Client Portal.

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security prospectus available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL field).

title: Make documents available
body: To make a security KID available to the user in FA Client Portal, add the link to it in FA Back (Security window, URL 2 field).

title: Make documents available
body: For more information on documents in FA Client Portal, see Documents view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: If you want to allow the user to trade in FA Client Portal, you need to enable trading on the portfolio and security level and specify the trading method:

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading for a portfolio, add the "Client Portal: Trade" tag to it in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trading in FA Client Portal, see Trading view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable buying and selling for a security, add the "Tradeable" tag to it in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). The user can only trade securities with this tag. For more information on buying and selling in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable the user to switch a fund position to another fund, add the "Tradeable" and "Switchable" tags to the security in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field). For more information on switching fund position in FA Client Portal, see Holdings view.

title: Enable trading and switching fund positions
body: To enable trading in units and trade amount, add the "Trade type: Buy units, Sell units, Buy trade amount, Sell trade amount" tags to a security in FA Back (Security window, Basic info tab).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: You can define which securities the user can trade per portfolio. For example, you can allow buying, selling, or switching only certain security types for a certain portfolio. To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: To restrict trading in FA Client Portal to specific securities only, do the following:

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Create a security group with the group code prefix "CP" in FA Back. For example, you can create a group for equities with the code "CP_ EQUITY". For details on how to create security groups, see Groups view.

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Link the security group to the user's portfolio in Portfolio window, Security groups tab in FA Back (see Portfolio window).

title: Restrict securities available for trading
body: Add the "Tradeable" tag to all securities in the group in FA Back (Security window, Other tags field).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: You can restrict access to actions like trading, depositing, and withdrawing based on a mandate between a specific contact and portfolio. This is useful if there are multiple individuals associated with a single portfolio who have distinct roles or permissions based on legal mandates or agreements. For example, you can set individual permissions for Portfolio A so that Person 1 is only able to buy and sell while Person 2 is only able to make withdrawals.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Access is provided by assigning "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio or Contact window. FA Client Portal checks the assigned tags and enables or disables actions for users based on them. You can provide access to trading on the following levels:

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Portfolio level: Provide access to trading for all users associated with a portfolio by assigning it "Client Portal" tags in the Portfolio window, Basic info tab (the portfolio is included in a dynamic group).

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Contact level (all portfolios): Provide a specific contact access to trading in all portfolios of another contact. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is contact B's representative. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contact window, Representatives tab. Contact A is the only user who gets access to the actions you assigned across all of B's portfolios.

title: Restrict access to trading based on contact and portfolio mandates
body: Individual portfolio level: Provide a specific contact access to trading in an individual portfolio. For example: Your user has a linked contact A who is linked to a specific portfolio in the Portfolio window, Contact tab or Asset managers tab, meaning they have access to the portfolio in FA Client Portal. You assign A some "Client Portal" tags in the Contacts or Asset managers tab. The actions you assigned are only activated for that specific portfolio and contact A.

title: Enable canceling trade orders
body: To enable the user to cancel trade orders with Open or Accepted status, add the "Client portal: Cancel orders" tag to the portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab). For more information on trade orders in FA Client Portal, see Orders view.

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: To set up deposits and withdrawals for the user, do the following:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Add the "Client portal: Deposit" and "Client portal: Withdraw" tags to the user's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Mark portfolio accounts to use for deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal. To do this, open the Portfolio window, Accounts tab in FA Back, and set the following properties for the accounts:

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Portfolio cash accounts: set the account category to "Internal".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to deposit funds from: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: Accounts to withdraw funds to: set the account category to "External".

title: Enable deposits and withdrawals
body: If you define multiple external accounts in the user's portfolio, FA Client Portal shows the Deposit from and Withdraw to fields in the Deposit and Withdrawal windows, where the user can choose the external account to use. For more information on deposits and withdrawals in FA Client Portal, see Deposits and withdrawals.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly investments for the user:

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: Add the "Client portal: Monthly investments" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: To enable monthly savings for the user, add the "Client portal: Monthly savings" tag to the client's portfolio in FA Back (Portfolio window, Basic info tab).

title: Enable monthly investments and monthly savings
body: The user can only set up investment or savings plans for portfolios with the required tag. For more information on monthly investments and monthly savings, see Monthly investments in FA Client Portal and Monthly savings in FA Client Portal in FA Client Portal.

title: Set up pledging portfolios and positions
body: The FA system allows users to pledge portfolios and portfolio positions so they can't be traded, moved, or changed. Pledged positions can also be unpledged to make them available for trading again. To pledge positions, users need to set up a separate pledged portfolio. When positions are pledged or unpledged, the system creates corresponding transactions in both the original portfolio and the pledged portfolio. You need to configure the transaction type for these transactions in FA Back.

title: Select transaction types
body: When users pledge or unpledge a portfolio position, the FA system creates corresponding "add" and "remove" transactions in the original portfolio and the pledged portfolio. You need to select the transaction types the system should use for these transactions:

title: Select transaction types
body: In FA Back, go to Preference → Portfolios → Portfolios.

title: Select transaction types
body: Define the fields Removing position from portfolio and Adding position to portfolio (for details, see Portfolios in FA Back reference).

title: Select transaction types
body: Click Save.

title: Select transaction types
body: The system now uses the selected transaction types to create transactions when positions are pledged or unpledged.

title: Related links
body: Pledge portfolios and positions in FA User guide

title: Trade order management settings
body: Trade order management settings

title: Related links
body: Trade order management in FA User guide

title: Related links
body: Trade order management in FA Back reference

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: The Fundsettle Euroclear trading integration is for inbound and outbound trading of funds (basic type FUND) and uses FTP for connectivity. Before 16.11.2024, the trading format is ISO20022V4. After 16.11.2024, the trading format is ISO20022V5. You can:

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: Receive inbound fund subscriptions and redemptions for funds managed in the FA system.

title: Set up Fundsettle trading integration
body: Send outbound fund subscriptions and redemptions from the FA system.

title: Inbound trading
body: The FA system receives fund subscription and redemption orders from Fundsettle. In response, the FA systems sends out acknowledgements and confirmations based on the trade order status.

title: Get access to Fundsettle and set the trading channel tag
body: You need to have Fundsettle generate a username and password for you before you can set up the trading connector. When you set up the connector in FA, you need to enter that username and password to establish the connection.

title: Get access to Fundsettle and set the trading channel tag
body: You also need to set the trading channel tag for fund trading as "TradingChannel-FundSettle". For more information about setting trading channel tags, see Add trading platform information.

title: Define accounts
body: To receive fund subscription and redemption order for funds managed in FA, you need to define two accounts for a fund portfolio:

title: Define accounts
body: Open the Portfolio window, IDs tab for the fund.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the distributor account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "KID".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the account ID.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK.

title: Define accounts
body: Click Add ID and define the Fundsettle account:

title: Define accounts
body: External name. Enter "AccountIdentification".

title: Define accounts
body: External ID. Enter the 5-digit account number from Fundsettle.

title: Define accounts
body: Click OK and then Save & close.

title: Define accounts
body: The fund can now receive fund subscription and redemption orders via the Fundsettle trading integration.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: After getting your credentials and defining the fund accounts, you can set up the inbound trading connection via Fundsettle by doing the following:

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Go to Tools → Administer → Trading connectors → Manage and click on "FundSettle" in the Trading Connections tab to expand the section.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Fill in the fields:

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Enable

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Tick this checkbox to enable the trading connector.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Username

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Enter the username generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Password

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Define the password generated by Fundsettle.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: FTP outbound location

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Import".

title: Set up the trading connector
body: FTP inbound location

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Enter "ftp.vpc.se:port/Export".

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Open the Advanced Settings tab and fill in the field in the "Inbound trading" section:

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Portfolio identification code, external ID

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Enter the KID.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: Click Done and then restart the trading connector by selecting Tools → Service bus message sender.

title: Set up the trading connector
body: As a result, the system shows a confirmation if the connection was established successfully.

title: Trade order status messages
body: The following table shows the inbound trade order status in FA and the corresponding message the FA system sends out.

title: Set up user access to FA Advisor
body: Users of FA Advisor need the correct rights to access the app and its functionalities such as trading on behalf of customers.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: To access FA Advisor, a user needs the correct rights in FA Admin Console. To provide a user access to FA Advisor, do the following:

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: Ensure the FA Advisor application is enabled. Contact FA if you need to enable it.

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the ROLE_USER right within the FA Advisor role (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to FA Advisor
body: If limited visibility is in use, it also applies to FA Advisor and the user can see the same customers as in FA Back (see Access for employees in FA Admin guide).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: To trade on behalf of customers in FA Advisor, a user needs to have the rights to impersonate customers in FA Client Portal. To provide a user the rights, do the following:

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: Make sure the user has access to FA Advisor (see Access to FA Advisor).

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the following rights (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide):

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL_IMPERSONATE within the FA Back role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: ROLE_IMPERSONATE within the FA Client Portal role.

title: Access to trading via FA Client Portal
body: The user can now access a customer's investments via FA Client Portal and trade on their behalf. A banner at the top of the view shows what the user has the rights to do with green checkmarks (buy, sell, switch, deposit, withdraw, and cancel orders).

title: Enable features for FA Advisor users
body: You can enable features like report generation and document signing for FA Advisor users.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: To enable FA Advisor users to generate reports, you need to make them available in FA Back:

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Go to New → New report and select the report packages or combined report packages you want to make available to generate in FA Advisor.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Fill in the fields. You don't need to define the Customer, group, portfolio or Date period fields. For field descriptions, see Report window in FA Back reference.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Tick the Available in other applications checkbox.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: Click Generate report.

title: Make reports available to generate via FA Advisor
body: After the reports are made available in FA Advisor, users can generate and download them according to their needs.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: When FA Advisor users trade on behalf of customers via FA Client Portal, the trade orders they create need to be signed by customers before being executed. To enable sending trade orders for signing, do the following:

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Make sure the FA Advisor user has access to trading via FA Client Portal (see Access to trading via FA Client Portal).

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Set up document signing in FA Back (see Document signing in FA User guide). The signing functionality is provided through Signicat services which need to be configured by FA.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: After the document signing functionality is enabled, customers receive signing requests for trade orders created by FA Advisor users.

title: Enable features for FA Advisor users
body: You can enable features like report generation and document signing for FA Advisor users.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: When FA Advisor users trade on behalf of customers via FA Client Portal, the trade orders can be sent for signing to customers before being executed. To enable sending trade orders for signing, do the following:

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Make sure the FA Advisor user has access to trading via FA Client Portal (see Access to trading via FA Client Portal).

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: Set up document signing in FA Back (see Document signing in FA User guide). The signing functionality is provided through Signicat services which need to be configured by FA.

title: Enable sending documents for signing
body: After the document signing functionality is enabled, customers receive signing requests for trade orders created by FA Advisor users.

title: FA Back setup
body: FA Back setup

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: FA Back comes with pre-configured saved views that are linked to specific functionalities, such as payment processing or trade order execution. These saved views are shown as tabs. If you don't need a saved view, you can hide it to keep the list of views shorter and easier to use. Hidden views are only shown to the users with ROLE_HIDE_VIEW right. To hide a view:

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: Don't remove standard views with the Remove button – removed views are restored with version upgrades.

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: Go to the view that you want to hide and click Modify on the top right.

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: Select Shared with role HIDE_VIEW from the dropdown.

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: Click Save.

title: Hide standard FA Back views
body: If you have the required admin role to hide the views, you are also able to see the views. To see the changes you made, you need to log in as a regular user.

title: FA Client Portal setup
body: FA Client Portal is an app that provides access to investment information for your clients. The app runs in the web browser on desktop and mobile devices and allows your clients to see their holdings, transactions, trade orders, and documents. You can learn more about FA Client Portal from FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can install FA Client Portal from Optional packages:

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Install FA Client Portal in FA Back. Go to Tools → Administer → Install optional packages. In the Other packages section, choose FA Client Portal and click Install.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: If you intend to use FA Client Portal impersonation feature, go to Tools → Administer → FA Client Portal → Configurations → Impersonation in FA Back. Enter the intended URL of the FA Client Portal, for example, https://myportal.com.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Provide access to FA Client Portal. To do this, follow the steps in Set up user access to FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: Contact FA customer service to set up test and production URLs for FA Client Portal.

title: Install FA Client Portal
body: You can have multiple instances of FA Client Portal installed (for example, with different logos and branding). For this, contact FA customer service.

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Follow the instructions below to set up access to FA Client Portal:

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Access for end users - Create a user and specify contacts and portfolios the user can access.

title: Set up user access to FA Client Portal
body: Impersonation mode for troubleshooting - Set up view-only access to client information for advisors, support service, and so on.

title: Access for end users
body: FA Client Portal provides end clients with access to investment information. The user can access:

title: Access for end users
body: Their own portfolios and subportfolios.

title: Access for end users
body: Portfolios and subportfolios of the contacts the user represents – for example, if the user represents their child or a company they work for. A representative can switch between the contacts in FA Client Portal by clicking .

title: Access for end users
body: To provide access to FA Client Portal, you need to:

title: Access for end users
body: Add a new user as described in Managing users in FA Admin guide. Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_CLIENT_ACCESS and FA Back/ ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Access for end users
body: Set up the user’s access to client information stored in FA Back:

title: Access for end users
body: To let the user access their own investment information, make sure the user's contact is specified as a primary contact for the portfolio (see Contacts) and link this contact to the user in FA Admin console (to do this, follow the steps in Link a contact to the user).

title: Access for end users
body: To let a representative access the linked contacts’ information in FA Client Portal, add the user as the contact’s representative in the Contact window, Representatives tab.

title: Impersonation mode
body: Impersonation mode

title: Impersonation mode
body: View-only mode lets advisors and support service specialists access the same view as the client sees, without being able to make any modifications. To access client accounts in FA Client Portal view-only:

title: Impersonation mode
body: Assign the user a role or roles with the following rights in FA Admin Console: FA Client Portal/ ROLE_IMPERSONATE and FA Back/ROLE_CLIENT_PORTAL_IMPERSONATE. This will enable impersonation mode in FA Client Portal, and enable launching it from FA Back. Contact FA customer services if you can't see the listed roles.

title: Impersonation mode
body: View FA Client Portal for a contact in the impersonate mode:

title: Impersonation mode
body: In FA Back, right-click the contact in the Overview and choose "Impersonate in Client Portal".

title: Impersonation mode
body: FA Client Portal opens in a new tab in your browser.

title: Modify FA Client Portal
body: You can modify FA Client Portal by uploading logos, adding translations and filling the Contact us page. To do this, follow the instructions in this section. If you want to do more, for example, modify the views, styles and branding, you need to make a fully customized version (see Customize FA Client Portal in FA Developer guide).

title: Related links

title: Related links

title: FA Front setup
body: FA Front setup

title: Add warnings for NAV calculation
body: The default decision table contains several types of warnings which you can adjust. For more information about each warning type, see View warnings in FA Fund Management. You can adjust, for example, the percentage by which a security price can change before causing a warning, or the list of securities that should be excluded when checking that a market price history exists.

title: Adjust the warnings
body: To adjust the warnings, you need to download and edit the default decision table before uploading it into the FA system. Download the default decision table:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: fa-decisiontable-fundrules.xlsx

title: Adjust the warnings
body: To adjust the warnings, do the following:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: Open the XLSX file you downloaded and adjust the warnings as needed.

title: Adjust the warnings
body: Upload the file to the document bank (FundRules folder). If the folder does not exist yet, create it by uploading your file and renaming it by adding "FundRules/" in front of the file name (for example: "FundRules/myfile.xlsx").

title: Adjust the warnings
body: After uploading the file, go to the GraphQL for API view and run the following code:

title: Adjust the warnings
body: mutation updateRules{ reloadFundRules }.

title: Audit search view
body: The Audit search view allows you to access audit logs that track user activity and system events such as report data and market price updates in FA apps. To view the list of logged events, see FA audit logs.

title: Viewing options
body: You can:

title: Viewing options
body: Search the table by user, target ID, or applications (fields at the top) or the quick search bar (indicated by the icon).

title: Viewing options
body: Refresh the table content by clicking at the top right.

title: Viewing options
body: Export the audit logs as an XLSX file by clicking Export.

title: Viewing options
body: Adjust the table (see Adjust the view) and group the table information by certain columns (click on and then Group by).

title: Adjust the view
body: You can adjust the table layout and specify the search criteria and then save these modifications for later:

title: Adjust the view
body: Make your adjustments. You can:

title: Adjust the view
body: Adjust columns.

title: Adjust the view
body: Show or hide columns ().

title: Adjust the view
body: Reorder by dragging and dropping.
