title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 1 tr.parentPortfolio Yes Portfolio ID String (unique ID of the transaction's portfolio)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 2 tr.extId No Transaction External ID External ID / number of you transaction. If left empty, an external ID is generated for the transaction by the system. In addition, system defines an internal ID as well. External ID is used in combination with #1 Portfolio ID to update existing transactions - if your external ID already exists, the existing transaction is updated.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 3 tr.type Yes Type Type code (configured in the system). E.g. buy, sell etc.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 4 tr.status No Status Define as a code: OK = Accepted DEL = Deleted NF = Not finished

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 5 tr.transactionDate Yes Transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 6 tr.settlementDate No Settlement date yyyy-MM-dd In addition, you can use numbers between 1 and 99 to set the settlement date (the settlement date is set the inserted number of business days after the transaction date). The transaction's security's (or cash transaction's currency's) holiday calendar is used to determine which days are business days.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 7 tr.maturityDate No Maturity date Not used. Only available for transactions on securities with base type DEPOSIT (not regular deposit transactions). Use format yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 8 tr.security No Security Security code of the transaction's security. Leave empty, if a cash transaction. In addition to security code, importing transactions is supported with ISIN code, trade code or update codes 1 through 3. When importing transactions by using ISIN code to identify the security, the system checks that the transaction’s currency (column #11 Currency) matches the found security’s currency, if there are multiple securities with the same ISIN code in the system.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 9 tr.securityType No Security type Security type code of the transaction's security's type (as configured in the system). Used to determine features of a transaction.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 10 tr.account No Account Account number, if transaction is directed to an account. You can use the an account linked to the portfolio or shared to the portfolio. Define AUTO to record the transactions to the account with the same currency as the transaction, if such an account is found, or to the default account of the portfolio, if suitable currency account is not found. Define DEFAULT to always direct the transaction to the portfolio's default account. The system ignores white spaces in account numbers, and is thus able to recognize account numbers (such as IBAN numbers) defined with or without white spaces.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 11 tr.currency No Currency Transaction's currency (define with the currency code). If you don't define a currency for your transaction, the system will automatically determine it based on your transaction's data (available from FA 3.9 onward). Transaction's currency is either 1) Transaction's security's currency (if transaction is linked to a security) 2) Transaction's account's currency (for transactions not linked to a security but linked to account, i.e. CASH transactions) 3) Transaction's portfolio's currency (for transactions not linked to a security nor account, i.e. CASH transactions with "No account") After 3.9, best practice is to leave the currency empty, and the system will determine it for you. Before FA 3.9, transaction's currency was a mandatory field: define the currency with the currency security's code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 12 tr.amount Yes Amount Number of units. The tr.amount field accepts the amount of decimals allowed for the transaction. If your file has more decimals in the amount, the amount is rounded to contain only accepted amount of decimals. For cash transactions, the number of decimals is defined per account (see Portfolio window), per currency security in the Block size field (see Security window) or per security type in Preferences (see Preferences - Securities). For the other transactions, the number of decimals is can be defined per account (see Portfolio window) or taken from the decimal format Preferences. When importing new transactions, if number of units is not available, you can leave it empty so the system calculates the amount with "unitPrice" (#13) and "tradeAmount" (#14). When updating existing transactions, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 13 tr.unitPrice Yes Unit price Unit price is security currency (trade currency). Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. For bonds, unit price can be set with % (e.g. 3.45%), when the system calculates the price according to YTM automatically. When importing new transactions, if unit price is not available or is inaccurate, you can leave it empty, so the system calculates the unit price with "amount" (#12) and "tradeAmount" (#14). When updating existing transactions, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 14 tr.tradeAmount Yes Trade amount Value of the transaction in security currency (trade currency), i.e. money value of the transaction including costs, taxes, accrued interest etc. When importing new transactions, if trade amount is not available, you can leave it empty, so the system calculates the trade amount with "amount" (#12) and "unitPrice" (#13). When updating existing transactions, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 15 tr.fxRate No FX rate Exchange rate for the transaction. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. When importing an FX rate, the system automatically determines whether the exchange rate is account exchange rate (column #41) and/or report exchange rate (column #42), and fills them in appropriately. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 16 tr.tax No Tax Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 17 tr.cost No Cost Fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 18 tr.cost2 No Cost 2 Credit fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 19 tr.origTransactionDate No Booked transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 20 tr.origUnitPrice No Booked unit price Booked unit price in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 21 tr.origTradeAmount No Booked trade amount Booked trade amount. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the booked trade amount by multiplying the amount with transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 22 tr.origFxRate No Booked FX rate Booked exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the original transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 23 tr.accruedInterest No Accrued interest Accrued interest in trade currency. For bonds, the accrued interest can be set with "?", when the system calculates the accrued interest automatically. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the accrued interest.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 24 tr.reference No Reference Reference of the transaction, usually transaction's reference number. Reference is used in combination with #1 Portfolio ID to update existing transactions if you haven't defined #2 External ID in your import file - if your reference can be found from an existing transaction, the existing transaction is updated.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 25 tr.counter No Counter Counter (use contact ID)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 26 tr.counterPortfolio No Counter portfolio Counter portfolio (use portfolio code)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: (27) (Ext info) Not used. Use tr.description in column #31 instead.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 28 tr.intInfo No Internal info Internal transaction description

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 29 tr.basis No Basis Not used.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 30 tr.priority No Priority Intraday priority of a transaction. -1,1,2,3... The transaction with the lowest priority has the highest number defined in the priority field (0 is lower than 1 and -1 is lower than 0). The default priority is 0.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 31 tr.description No Description Description/comment on the transaction

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 32 tr.security2 No Security 2 Security code of the removed security (e.g. in the exchange, the one that is replaced)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 33 tr.ratio No Ratio Define the ratio with syntax x:x (e.g. 1:2 or 2:3.25). Ratio is used for example for splits and exchanges. For splits, define the ratio between the number of securities before and after the split (with ratio 1:2, one security before the split would become two securities after the split). For exchanges, define the ratio as how many new securities are received with one removed security (with ratio 1:2, one removed security would become two new securities after the exchange).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 34 tr.taxType No Tax type Tax type of the transaction defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 35 tr.marketPlace No Market place Use the exchange code / market place code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 36 tr.tradeTime No Trade time hh:mm:ss You can also define the trade time with time zone information with the syntax of hh:mm:ssContinent/City (e.g. 11:12:13Europe/Helsinki, use valid java time zones) - when the transaction is imported, the trade time is converted into the server's time zone.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 37 tr.tax2 No Tax 2 Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 38 tr.taxType2 No Tax 2 type Tax type of the transaction defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 39 tr.tags No Tags The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your transactions.To add a tag: Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a Fund tag and an Urgent tag, you can add them like this: "Fund,Urgent".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a transaction already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags to your Campaign group, you can add them like this: "Campaign:EarlyBird,Campaign:Friends". If a transaction already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example: To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Campaign:EarlyBird" and "Campaign:Friends", you can use "---Campaign:EarlyBird,---Campaign:Friends". For details, see Removing transaction and trade order values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 40 tr.settlementPlace No Settlement place Use the settlement code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 41 tr.accountFxRate No Account FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's account currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need the account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 42 tr.reportFxRate No Report FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need the account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 43 tr.coefficient No Coefficient Coefficient calculated from the linked security's price and index base value. Affects trade amount same as unit price. Define AUTO to automatically calculate coefficient on the transaction date from the linked security and index base value.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 44 tr.compCost1 No Break-down of cost 1 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax <type>=<value>. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost (column #17), your Break-down of cost 1 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 45 tr.compCost2 No Break-down of cost 2 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax <type>=<value>. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost 2 (column #18), your Break-down of cost 2 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 46 tr.costType1 No Transaction cost type 1 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 47 tr.costType2 No Transaction cost type 2 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 48 tr.hidden No Hidden Whether the transaction should be marked as hidden. Define as a number: 1 = Hidden 0 = Not hidden (default)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 49 tr.paymentDate No Payment date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 50 tr.accrual No Accrual Transaction's accrual, or the the paid/received accrued income which is recorded as part of the price (unit price x amount). Accrual has no effect of the trade amount (Available from FA 3.7 onward)

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 51 tr.receiveDate No Receive date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 52 tr.receiveTime No Receive time hh:mm:ss You can also define the receive time with time zone information with the syntax of hh:mm:ssContinent/City (e.g. 11:12:13Europe/Helsinki, use valid java time zones) - when the trade order is imported, the time is converted into the server's time zone.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 53 tr.accrual2 No Removed accrual Removed accrual from security A when making an Exchange for security B.

title: FA Format for importing transactions
body: 54 tr.overrideFifoTransactionExtId No Override FIFO (ext ID) List the external transaction IDs that represent purchase lots, separated by commas. The transactions need to pass the required validations (see Transaction information in FA Back reference).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 1 o.parentPortfolio Yes Portfolio ID String (unique ID of trade order's portfolio)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 2 o.extId No Trade order External ID External trade order ID. If left empty, an external ID is generated to the trade order. In addition, system defines an internal ID as well.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 3 o.type Yes Type Type code (configured in the system). E.g. buy, sell etc.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 4 o.status Yes Order status Define as a number: 1 = Executable 2 = Executed 3 = Cancelled 4 = Open 5 = Accepted 6 = In execution 7 = Executed in the market 8 = Rejected 9 = Expired 10 = Sent to execution 11 = Settled in the market 12 = Partially executed in the market

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 5 o.transactionDate Yes Transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 6 o.settlementDate No Settlement date yyyy-MM-dd. In addition, use numbers between 1 and 99 to set the settlement date (the settlement date is set the inserted number of banking days after the transaction date).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 7 o.maturityDate No Maturity date Not used. Only available for transactions on securities with base type DEPOSIT (not regular deposit transactions). Use format yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 8 o.security No Security Security code of the trade order's security. Leave empty, if a cash trade order. In addition to security code, importing trade orders is supported with ISIN code, trade code or update codes 1 through 3.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 9 o.securityType No Security type Security type code of the trade order's security's type (as configured in the system). Used to determine features of a trade order.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 10 o.account No Account Account number, if trade order is directed to an account (trade orders often don't have an account). You can use the an account linked to the portfolio or shared to the portfolio. Define AUTO to record the trade order to the account with the same currency as the trade order, if such an account is found, or to the default account of the portfolio, if suitable currency account is not found. Define DEFAULT to always direct the trade order to the portfolio's default account. The system ignores white spaces in account numbers, and is thus able to recognize account numbers (such as IBAN numbers) defined with or without white spaces.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 11 o.currency No Currency Trade order's currency (define with the currency code). If you don't define a currency for your trade order, the system will automatically determine it based on your trade order's data (available from FA 3.9 onward). Trade order's currency is either 1) Trade order's security's currency (if trade order is linked to a security)2) Trade order's account's currency (for trade orders not linked to a security but linked to account, i.e. CASH transactions)3) Trade order's portfolio's currency (for trade orders not linked to a security nor account, i.e. CASH transactions with "No account") ! After 3.9, best practice is to leave the currency empty, and the system will determine it for you. Before FA 3.9, trade order's currency was a mandatory field: define the currency with the currency security's code.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 12 o.amount Yes Amount Number of units. Amount field only accepts the amount of decimals defined for the security type or as the block size of the security: if your file has more decimals in the amount, the amount is rounded to contain only accepted amount of decimals. When importing new trade orders, if number of units is not available, you can leave it empty, so the system calculates the amount with "unitPrice" (#13) and "tradeAmount" (#14). When updating existing trade orders, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 13 o.unitPrice Yes Unit price Unit price is security currency (trade currency). Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. When importing new trade orders, if unit price is not available or it is inaccurate, you can leave it empty, when the system calculates the unit price with "amount" (#12) and "tradeAmount" (#14). When updating existing trade orders, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 14 o.tradeAmount Yes Trade amount Value of the transaction in security currency (trade currency), i.e. money value of the transaction including costs, taxes, accrued interest etc. When importing new trade orders, if trade amount is not available, you can leave it empty, when the system calculates the trade amount with "amount" (#12) and "unitPrice" (#13). When updating existing trade orders, make sure the field has the correct value, or let the FA system calculate the value by including the empty field in the import file (or API call).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 15 o.fxRate No FX Rate Exchange rate for the trade order. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. When importing an FX rate, the system automatically determines whether the exchange rate is account exchange rate (column #41) and/or report exchange rate (column #42), and fills them in appropriately.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 16 o.tax No Tax Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 17 o.cost No Cost Fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 18 o.cost2 No Cost 2 Credit fee in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 19 o.origTransactionDate No Booked transaction date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 20 o.origUnitPrice No Booked unit price Booked unit price in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 21 o.origTradeAmount No Booked trade amount Booked trade amount. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the booked trade amount by multiplying the amount with transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 22 o.origFxRate No Booked fx rate Booked exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the original transaction day's market data entry.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 23 o.accruedInterest No Accrued interest Accrued interest in trade currency. For bonds, the accrued interest can be set with "?", when the system calculates the accrued interest automatically. Define AUTO to automatically calculate the accrued interest.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 24 o.reference No Reference Reference

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 25 o.counter No Counter Counter (use contact ID)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 26 o.counterPortfolio No Counter portfolio Counter portfolio (use portfolio code)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: (27) No No (Ext info) Not used. Use tr.description in column #31 instead.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 28 o.intInfo No Internal info Internal transaction description

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 29 o.basis No Basis Not used.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 30 o.priority No Priority Intraday priority of a trade order. -1,1,2,3... The trade order with the lowest priority has the highest number defined in the priority field (0 is lower than 1 and -1 is lower than 0). The default priority is 0.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 31 o.description No Description Description/comment on the trade order

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 32 o.security2 No Security 2 Security code of the removed security (e.g. in the exchange, the one that is replaced)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 33 o.ratio No Ratio Define the ratio with syntax x:x (e.g. 1:2 or 2:3.25). Ratio is used for example for splits and exchanges. For splits, define the ratio between the number of securities before and after the split (with ratio 1:2, one security before the split would become two securities after the split). For exchanges, define the ratio as how many new securities are received with one removed security (with ratio 1:2, one removed security would become two new securities after the exchange).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 34 o.taxType No Tax type Tax type of the trade order defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 35 o.marketPlace No Market place Use the exchange code / market place code.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 36 o.tradeTime No Trade time hh:mm:ss You can also define the trade time with time zone information with the syntax of hh:mm:ssContinent/City (e.g. 11:12:13Europe/Helsinki, use valid java time zones) - when the trade order is imported, the trade time is converted into the server's time zone.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 37 o.tax2 No Tax2 Tax in trade currency

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 38 o.taxType2 No Tax 2 type Tax type of the trade order defined with the tax type code

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 39 o.tags No Tags The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your trade orders. To add a tag: Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a Fund tag and an Urgent tag, you can add them like this: "Fund,Urgent".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a trade order already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags to your Campaign group, you can add them like this: "Campaign:EarlyBird,Campaign:Friends". If a trade order already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example: To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Campaign:EarlyBird" and "Campaign:Friends", you can use "---Campaign:EarlyBird,---Campaign:Friends". For details, see Removing transaction and trade order values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 40 o.settlementPlace No Settlement place Use the settlement code.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 41 o.accountFxRate No Account FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's account currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need the account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 42 o.reportFxRate No Report FX rate Exchange rate between trade currency and portfolio's report currency. Define the exchange rate in the direction of the matching currency cross which has been defined in the FA system. Define AUTO to automatically use the transaction day's market data entry. If you are not sure whether you need the account or report FX rate, use FX rate (column #15) instead, which automatically determines which one to use.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 43 o.coefficient No Coefficient Coefficient calculated from the linked security's price and index base value. Affects trade amount same as unit price. Define AUTO to automatically calculate coefficient on the transaction date from the linked security and index base value.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 44 o.compCost1 No Break-down of cost 1 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax type=value. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost (column #17), your Break-down of cost 1 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs. (Available from FA 3.1.3 onward)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 45 o.compCost2 No Break-down of cost 2 Define the break-down of costs as a list of transaction cost data with the syntax type=value. Types are from defined transaction cost type. E.g. BROK=15,ADV=22. If you also defined a Cost 2 (column #18), your Break-down of cost 2 has to sum up to the total cost you defined! If you leave Cost empty, the system calculates it automatically as the sum of your break-down of costs.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 46 o.costType1 No Transaction cost type 1 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 47 o.costType2 No Transaction cost type 2 Type of selected transaction cost type. Value is from defined transaction cost type's type code.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 48 o.hidden No Hidden Whether the trade order should be marked as hidden. Define as a number: 1 = Hidden 0 = Not hidden (default)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 49 o.paymentDate No Payment date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 50 o.accrual No Accrual Trade order's accrual, or the the paid/received accrued income which is recorded as part of the price (unit price x amount). Accrual has no effect of the trade amount. (Available from FA 3.7 onward)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 51 o.executionMethod No Execution method Trade order's execution method. Define as a number: 1 = Not defined (default)2 = Units3 = Gross trade amount4 = Net trade amount Trade order gets the default value 1 "Not defined" if the field is imported as empty or as ”0” (0 is used only for transactions, since transactions don't have an execution method). Otherwise, values other than number from 1 to 4 are not allowed. (Available from FA 3.8 onward)

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 52 o.receiveDate No Receive date yyyy-MM-dd

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 53 o.receiveTime No Receive time hh:mm:ss You can also define the receive time with time zone information with the syntax of hh:mm:ssContinent/City (e.g. 11:12:13Europe/Helsinki, use valid java time zones) - when the trade order is imported, the time is converted into the server's time zone.

title: FA Format for importing trade orders
body: 54 o.overrideFifoTransactionExtId No Override FIFO (ext ID) List the external transaction IDs that represent purchase lots, separated by commas. The transactions need to pass the required validations (see Transaction information in FA Back reference).

title: Enter key figure values manually or select from a pre-defined list
body: Option Example Purpose

title: Enter key figure values manually or select from a pre-defined list
body: Value 1 2 3 Allows users to select directly from a list of values. The values can be numbers or text. The user selection is stored directly.

title: Enter key figure values manually or select from a pre-defined list
body: Value-text pair 1=Poor 2=OK 3=Good Text is associated with a numeric value. Users select from text options ranging from "Poor" to "Good", and the selection is stored as a number. You can then calculate, for example, averages based on user selections.

title: General
body: Preference Description

title: General
body: Posting generation

title: General
body: Choose the action on transaction saving Option to choose if postings are generated on transaction save: Ask the user if postings should be generated - The system asks you to choose if postings should be generated when you save a transaction.Always generate postings when saving a transaction - The system automatically generates postings every time you save a transaction.Never generate postings when saving a transaction - The system never generates postings when you save a transaction.

title: General
body: Generate zero-amount postings Option to generate postings when the posting amount is zero.

title: General
body: Tag for transactions that generate no postings Tag to apply to transactions to skip the generation of postings.

title: General
body: Posting rules

title: General
body: Generate postings in the portfolio currency Option to use only specific posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. By default, all posting rules are applied to generate postings. This option is selected by default. If you don't want to generate postings in the portfolio currency, either select to generate them in the security currency or the account currency instead.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the portfolio currency Posting rules to generate postings in the portfolio currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the security currency Option to generate some postings in the security currency.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the security currency Posting rules to generate postings in the security currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Generate postings in the account currency Option to generate some postings in the currency of the security related to the transaction. Only unique currency postings are generated.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in the account currency Posting rules to generate postings in the account currency. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Currency codes to generate postings in other currencies Currencies other than the account currency in which postings should be generated. Specify the currency codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Posting rule codes to generate postings in other currencies Posting rules to generate postings in other currencies. Applied to all if empty. Specify the posting rule codes as a comma-separated list. You also need to add the rules to the portfolio in the Portfolio window, Posting rule field.

title: General
body: Use currency posting rules for security-based transactions with accounts not in the portfolio currency Option to generate separate postings for currency exchange if the security sell or buy is made against an account with a currency different from the portfolio currency. If you enable this option, create posting rules against the currency security type with transaction types buy and sell.

title: General
body: Security type codes that get the purchase value from the cash account purchase price (default: “CASH, FUTCF”) Securities that take the purchase value from the average purchase price of cash in the booked account. This setting is needed if the purchase value and profit are to be booked on cash-type transactions. By default, this is cash (CASH) and future cashflows (FUTCF). Specify the security codes as a comma-separated list.

title: General
body: Posting amount

title: General
body: Use book values for calculating FX profit and loss Option to use the book FX values in currency profit and loss calculation.

title: General
body: Apply rounding before calculating the posting amount Option to round posting charge amounts individually before the total amount is saved for the posting. If you disable this option, rounding is applied to the total posting amount.

title: General
body: Disable the netting of postings Option to disable the netting of postings. Netting means that if a transaction generates multiple postings against the same bookkeeping account for the same date, they are summed up and only one posting is saved. If you disable this option, each posting rule generates a separate posting. As a result, a single transaction can have multiple postings against the same account on the same day.

title: General
body: Bookkeeping accounts

title: General
body: Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined (for example “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”) Bookkeeping account numbers per currency to use ACC account postings if the portfolio secondary account number is undefined. Format: “Currency code=Account number”. For example, “SEK=1921,EUR=1922”.

title: General
body: Use these accounts also when the bookkeeping account code is ACC and the portfolio’s secondary account number is defined Option to always use the specified account numbers for ACC accounts, even if the portfolio secondary account number is defined.

title: Available charge types
body: Charge type Description

title: Available charge types
body: Price Corresponds to the calculated price shown in the transaction window, for example, Amount * Unit price.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (no cost) Takes into account the purchase price, without costs, associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total tax Corresponds to the sum of the values in the tax fields of the transaction, for example, Tax 1 and Tax 2 together.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest Corresponds to the value in the Accrued interest field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total price Corresponds to the Total trade amount of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Credit fee Corresponds to the value in the upper Cost type field of the transaction (by default, this field is marked as "Credit fee"). You can use this charge type to treat all costs entered in this field as an aggregate to add or subtract. If you are using the breakdown of transaction costs (see Breakdown of transaction costs), use the list of individual transaction cost types below.

title: Available charge types
body: Fee Corresponds to the value in the lower Cost type field of the transaction (by default, this field is marked as "Fee"). You can use this charge type to treat all costs entered in this field as an aggregate to add or subtract. If you are using the breakdown of transaction costs (see Breakdown of transaction costs), use the list of individual transaction cost types below.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price Takes into account the purchase price associated with the transaction. If booked values are defined, they are taken into account.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss Takes into account the loss induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit Takes into account the profit induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Currency loss Takes into account the currency loss induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Currency profit Takes into account the currency profit induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss (no cost) Takes into account the loss, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit (no cost) Takes into account the profit, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 1 Corresponds to the value in the upper Tax type field of the transaction. You can use this charge type to treat all tax types entered in this field as an aggregate to add or subtract. To separately specify how each tax type should be treated, use the list of individual tax types.

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 2 Corresponds to the value in the lower Tax type field of the transaction. You can use this charge type to treat all tax types entered in this field as an aggregate to add or subtract. To separately specify how each tax type should be treated, use the list of individual tax types.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (orig.) Takes into account the original purchase price associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest (purch.) Takes into account the accrued interest associated with the purchase transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Nominal value Corresponds to the Amount field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Individual tax and transaction cost types

title: Available charge types
body: Tax types The tax types correspond to the Tax type fields of the transaction. With the individual tax types, you can specify how each type should be treated in the posting rule, meaning if they are added or subtracted. The available tax types include both standard and custom tax types defined in Preference - Taxation.

title: Available charge types
body: Transaction cost types The transaction cost types correspond to the Cost type fields of the transaction. You can use the individual transaction cost types if you are using the breakdown of transaction costs (see Breakdown of transaction costs). With individual transaction cost types, you can specify how each type should be treated in the posting rule, meaning if they are added or subtracted. The available transaction cost types include those defined in Preference - Transactions.

title: Stub convention
body: Convention Description

title: Stub convention
body: None Explicitly states that there are no stubs. This option is used to indicate that the schedule evenly divides by the frequency, leaving no stubs. For example, 6 months can be exactly divided by a 3 month frequency.

title: Stub convention
body: Short initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in a 2 month initial short stub followed by two periods of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Long initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start and combined with the next period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month periodic frequency would result in a 5 month initial long stub followed by one period of 3 months.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart initial Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the start. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long initial up to 7 days and Short initial beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Short final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in two periods of 3 months followed by a 2 month final short stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Long final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end and combined with the previous period, making a total period longer than the standard frequency. For example, 8 months with a 3 month frequency would result in one period of 3 months followed by a 5 month final long stub.

title: Stub convention
body: Smart final Any remaining period, shorter than the frequency, will be allocated at the end. If this results in a stub of less than 7 days, the stub will be combined with the next period. If this results in a stub of 7 days or more, the stub will be retained. This is the equivalent of Long final up to 7 days and Short final beyond that. This convention appears to match that used by Bloomberg.

title: Stub convention
body: Both Both ends of the schedule have a stub. Days before the first period start date form the initial stub. Days after the last period end date form the final stub.

title: Business day convention
body: Convention Description

title: Business day convention
body: Following (default) Move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified following (without crossing mid-month or month end) Move to the next valid business day, unless that is after the 15th of the month OR in the next month in which case move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Preceding Move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Modified preceding (without crossing month start) Move to the previous valid business day, unless that is in the previous month in which case move to the next valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: Nearest For Sunday and Monday, move to the next valid business day, for all other days, move to the previous valid business day.

title: Business day convention
body: No adjustment Make no adjustment.
